body_html:
The motivation for this was that some of the overloaded aten operators are ambiguous without an explicit bool type:

aten::std(Tensor self, bool unbiased=True) -> Tensor
aten::std(Tensor self, int dim, bool unbiased=True, bool keepdim=False) -> Tensor

The ONNX stuff is tricky since we could just convert bools to ints on export but would lose that information on an import which would defeat the whole purpose of this PR.
body_text:
The motivation for this was that some of the overloaded aten operators are ambiguous without an explicit bool type:
aten::std(Tensor self, bool unbiased=True) -> Tensor
aten::std(Tensor self, int dim, bool unbiased=True, bool keepdim=False) -> Tensor

The ONNX stuff is tricky since we could just convert bools to ints on export but would lose that information on an import which would defeat the whole purpose of this PR.
body:
The motivation for this was that some of the overloaded `aten` operators are ambiguous without an explicit bool type:

```
aten::std(Tensor self, bool unbiased=True) -> Tensor
aten::std(Tensor self, int dim, bool unbiased=True, bool keepdim=False) -> Tensor
```

The ONNX stuff is tricky since we could just convert bools to ints on export but would lose that information on an import which would defeat the whole purpose of this PR.
